001package imagingbook.lib.math.testing;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
004import imagingbook.lib.math.eigen.Eigensolver2x2;
005//import imagingbook.lib.math.Eigensolver2x2;
006//import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
007import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
008
009/**
010 * This is a small demo program to show the use of the
011 * {@link Eigensolver2x2} class.
012 * It takes a 2x2 real-valued matrix and calculates its two
013 * eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
014 * Results are printed and checked.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 *@version 2020/03/25
018 */
019public class Eigensolver2x2Demo {
020        
021        public static void main(String[] args) {
022                
023                PrintPrecision.set(6);
024                
025                // specify a 2x2 matrix
026                double[][] M = {
027                                {3, -2},
028                                {-4, 1}};
029                
030                System.out.format("M =\n%s\n\n", Matrix.toString(M));
031                
032                Eigensolver2x2 solver = new Eigensolver2x2(M);
033                double[]   eigenvalues  = solver.getEigenvalues();
034                //double[][] eigenvectors = solver.getEigenvectors();
035                
036                System.out.println("eigenvalues/eigenvectors: check if M*x = \u03BB*x \n");
037                
038                for (int i = 1; i <= 2; i++) {
039                        // get the eigen-pair <lambda_i, x_i>
040                        double lambda = eigenvalues[i-1];
041                        double[] x = solver.getEigenvector(i-1);
042                        
043                        System.out.format("\u03BB_%d  = %.6f\n", i, lambda);
044                        System.out.format("x_%d = %s\n", i, Matrix.toString(x));
045                        
046                        System.out.format("Check: \u03BB_%d * x_%d = %s\n", i, i, Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(lambda, x)));
047                        System.out.format("Check:   M * x_%d = %s\n\n", i, Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(M, x)));
048                }
049
050        }
051}
052
053/*
054M =
055{{3.000000, -2.000000}, 
056{-4.000000, 1.000000}}
057
058eigenvalues/eigenvectors: check if M*x = λ*x 
059
060λ_1  = 5.000000
061x_1 = {4.000000, -4.000000}
062Check: λ_1 * x_1 = {20.000000, -20.000000}
063Check:   M * x_1 = {20.000000, -20.000000}
064
065λ_2  = -1.000000
066x_2 = {-2.000000, -4.000000}
067Check: λ_2 * x_2 = {2.000000, 4.000000}
068Check:   M * x_2 = {2.000000, 4.000000}
069*/
